<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public static String orderStrings(String input) {
    StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
    Map<Character, Integer> map = new LinkedHashMap<>();

    for (int i = 0; i < input.length(); i++) {
        char c = input.charAt(i);
        if (!map.containsKey(c)) {
            map.put(c, i);
        }
    }

    List<Map.Entry<Character, Integer>> list = new ArrayList<>(map.entrySet());
    list.sort(Map.Entry.comparingByValue());

    for (Map.Entry<Character, Integer> entry : list) {
        char c = entry.getKey();
        int count = Collections.frequency(input, c);
        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
            result.append(c);
        }
    }

    return result.toString();
}
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses a LinkedHashMap to keep track of the first appearance of each character in the input string. It then sorts the entries of the map based on their values (the index of the first appearance). Finally, it iterates over the sorted entries and appends the character to the result string the number of times it appears in the input string.
